text: Trust in the Salvation of Yahweh
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 13 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever?
How long will you hide your face from me?
How long must I take counsel\f + \fr 13:2 \ft Hebrew pl.; with a slight modification of the Hebrew this reads “set pains” \f* in my soul,
\add and\add* sorrow in my heart \add all the\add* day?
How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
Consider\f + \fr 13:3 \ft Literally “Look” \f* \add and\add* answer me, O Yahweh my God.
lest I sleep \add the sleep of\add* death,
\add and\add* lest my enemy should say, “I have overcome him,”
\add lest\add* my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.
But as for me, I have trusted in your steadfast love.\f + \fr 13:5 \ft Or, “loyal love” \f*
My heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
\f + \fr 13:6 \ft In the Hebrew Bible, the previous verse continues \f* I will sing to Yahweh
because he has dealt bountifully with me.
